title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement sachamber@fredhutch.org. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Getting Started
text: Run function proof_authenticate(), calls PROOF API HutchNet username password, returns API token (alphanumeric string). strongly recommend supply password proof_authenticate plain text like, instead pull password environment variable stored outside R. description different options store HutchNet password see R Startup chapter book Forgot Teach R. (note: token real token) Alternatively, save API token directly environment variable named PROOF_TOKEN can used proofr functions without exposing token code. , run following: Instead just setting token current R session, can set token can used across sessions putting token file read R starts . Create ~/.Renviron file (doesn’t exist already) contains PROOF_TOKEN=-token-available R session. Run chmod 0400 ~/.Renviron make sure can see contents. Make sure restart R session changes file changes picked .
code: my_proof_token <- proof_authenticate(username = "username", password = Sys.getenv("HUTCHNET_PWD")) my_proof_token #> xyGKibGctQ92rmMKKb39q43XgPxGCmrWoX7NZtamTjDP Sys.setenv("PROOF_TOKEN" = proof_authenticate("username", "password"))

title: Getting Started
text: Start PROOF server using proof_start() function: Note: proofr assumes one server running; ’ve started server using app, ’ll need stop server starting one R via proofr. Get metadata PROOF server started, including URL API, using wait=TRUE doesn’t return data server fully ready use.
code: proof_start() metadata <- proof_status(wait = TRUE) cromwell_url <- metadata$cromwellUrl cromwell_url

title: Getting Started
text: Load rcromwell two options setting URL rcromwell. first option set Cromwell server URL recognized rcromwell cromwell_config option pass url function, example: addition setting Cromwell URL, PROOF API token also required HTTP requests server. getting PROOF token can set env var PROOF_TOKEN, pass rcromwell functions, example:
code: if (!requireNamespace("rcromwell", quietly=TRUE)) {   install.packages("pak")   pak::pak("getwilds/rcromwell") } library(rcromwell) library(httr) cromwell_config(cromwell_url) cromwell_jobs(url = cromwell_url) cromwell_jobs(url = cromwell_url, token = my_proof_token)

title: Getting Started
text: example, cromwell_version() checks version Cromwell server See many functions rcromwell documentation.

title: Getting Started
text: ’re now setup interact Cromwell server. See rcromwell package docs get started.

title: Authenticate with PROOF API — proof_authenticate
text: strongly recommend supply password plain text like proof_authenticate(username = "jane", password = "mypassword"), rather pull password environment variable stored outside R like proof_authenticate(username = "jane", password = Sys.getenv("HUTCH_PWD"))

text: slurm_account (character) PI name form last_f, last last name PI f first name, e.g., "Jane Doe" doe_j; needed user one SLURM account. optional token (character) token bearer authentication PROOF API. default NULL. recommend passing token string. Either pass using Sys.getenv() save token env var passing nothing param find

text: Get PROOF API job status - job running, URL...

title: Get PROOF API job status - is job running, what's its URL... — proof_status
Get PROOF API job status - is job running, what's its URL... — proof_status
text: wait (logical) TRUE wait server ready interact . FALSE return immediately, want call function get server URL token (character) token bearer authentication PROOF API. default NULL. recommend passing token string. Either pass using Sys.getenv() save token env var passing nothing param find

title: Get PROOF API job status - is job running, what's its URL... — proof_status
text: list fields: canJobStart (logical): can job make Cromwell server started? FALSE server already running; TRUE server running jobStatus (character): status job controls Cromwell server. e.g., "RUNNING". NULL server running cromwellUrl (character): URL Cromwell server. NULL server running jobInfo (list): metadata Cromwell server. slots NULL server running

title: Get PROOF API job status - is job running, what's its URL... — proof_status
text: PROOF API unavailable, function timeout 5 seconds. Contact package maintainer get timeout error. See proof_timeout().

title: proofr v0.3.0
text: Swapping httr httr2 (@sckott #25) Improving documentation (@sckott #27, #28, #29, #30) Fixing linting errors identified GitHub Action (@tefirman @sckott #32)

title: proofr v0.2
text: Change token handling support Shiny workflow can’t store secrets env vars. functions now accept token, can also just set env var token. proof_authenticate longer sets env var token (#11)

title: proofr v0.1
text: Document server time 7 days (#10) Set curl timeout users don’t wait long timeout failure (#8) Surface error messages PROOF API useful users (#7) Change proof_start use slurm_account body param instead pi_name (#6) Write tests covering major points exported fxns (#5) export proof_header (#4) rcromwell <–> proofr integration (#2) PROOF API token caching (#1)
